>>> When running under JUnit, I would like to redirect the output of
>>> the applications to a log file, while STILL outputting my JUnit
>>> textUI.TestRunner results to the screen.

J. B. Rainsberger Sat, 19 Jun 2004 10:46:42 -0400
>> If the application uses the same streams as the test runner, then
>> what you ask is impossible.

>> The best you can do is customize the test runner (it's the path of
>> least resistance) to send its output somewhere different, then
>> redirect all standard output and standard error to files. You
>> should be able to extend the textui TestRunner and override the
>> ResultPrinter to print to a file, for example. Not too much work.

Miguel Pessoa Monteiro Mon, 21 Jun 2004 16:23:41 +0100
> I would like to point out that this kind of thing is very easy to do
> with aspect-oriented programming (though I doubt that someone is
> willing to learn AspectJ just to do that).
